reviews.text: We stayed here on Legoland package and this hotel represents good value, the rooms were acceptable if a little small & the location is very convenient for Legoland & fairly quiet. The pool is good for this standard of hotel, the staff was always helpful & the b'fast was fine. We have stayed on the same package at the Heathrow premier inn which was marginally cheaper but of a slightyly lower standard(still acceptable). Similarly we have also stayed at the Crowne Plaza near Heathrow which was more expensive but of a higher standard.
reviews.title: no surprises

reviews.text: We have just returned from a three night stay in the Copthorne Hotel. It is a large hotel that caters wonderfully for families. We were a party of five - 2 adults and 3 children (aged from 11 - 6). We booked a junior suite. The accomodation consisted of two adjoining rooms. There is an archway between the rooms but no door. There was a double bed in one room and a double pullout couch and a single camp bed in the other room. There was ample room for the five of us. The bathroom and bedrooms were extremely clean and pleasant. There was air conditioning but the windows could also be opened slightly.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel with great Legoland Deals

likes.disliked: — There really was nothing that we didn't like about it!

reviews.text: The breakfasts were the best buffet breakfasts we have come across anywhere. Everything seemed to be cooked in small batches, so everything was freshly cooked and hot. There was a very varied choice of breakfast.
reviews.title: Good stopover hotel - if you have a car

reviews.text: The Le Trouve restaurant food was also very good for evening food. The children has a choice of buffet food if they did not want to order from the menu.
reviews.title: Would definately recommend this hotel

likes.disliked: — The lack of choice on the dinner menu

reviews.title: Great location for Legoland but would recommend hiring a car.
reviews.text: The leisure club looked good but we didn't have time to use it.
We booked this hotel to enable us to day trip to Legoland. The hotel was booked via the Legoland website and was a great hotel for this purpose.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Good Value

likes.disliked: — Carpark was chaotic as the signage was poor

reviews.title: Somebody wee'd on the bed
reviews.text: The hotel was really clean, friendly and very good value for money. The breakfast was tasty and very filling, as much as you would want to eat.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: I would throughly recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for one night. When we arrived at the hotel we were given the key to our room we went off to the room and in checking the room out we pealed open the sheets to find out that someone had gone to the toilet on the bed. We called reception who moved us to a different rooms once we asked for them to do this.
reviews.title: Expensive And A Rip Off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our new room was clean. So we went down to the bar and had some food - food was pleasant but was very expensive as was the bar.
reviews.title: great location
Could have been better for the cost
reviews.text: Overall it was a reasonable experience, apart from being kept awake until one in the morning thanks to there being a party outside a family room.
The parking is rather steep considering the hotel is not that central to the town. Couldn't really justify it.
reviews.title: Good quality, pleasant staff and a great location for Legoland!

likes.disliked: — Getting up at 5.25am for a fire alarm and the heat in the room - maybe the two were related!

reviews.title: Comfortable and clean
reviews.text: Staff handle problems hastily.
Pity one had not control over the heating. Rather on the hot side for me.
reviews.title: do try brian turners grill restaurant

likes.liked: — the grill restaurant and staff in the hotel

reviews.text: My husband, son aged 5 and myself stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Legoland. We booked through Legoland and managed to get a reasonable rate which included tickets, breakfast (normaly £16.95 per head) and parking (£6 per day). We arrived quite late on the Friday night but had no problems with check in and were quite quickly on our way to our room on the 4th floor. The room itself was quite spacious and had a put up bed in addition to the double bed and the bedding was clean and fresh. There was no minibar as this was classed a standard room - you only get a minibar if you upgrade to a Club Room. All in all the room was fine although the air conditioning was not great and the room was very warm - I wouldn't like to imagine the temp during the summer. The bathroom was clean and tidy and the towels were nice and fluffy. The shower was fantastic. We ordered room service which was prompt and courteously delivered although nothing special for the cost. Breakfast was very organised with a good selection. On the Saturday evening a wedding was underway in the Hotel. There was some noise but we were all able to get to sleep quite easily - after a full day in Legoland you could probably sleep standing up. However - yes you guessed it - at 5.25am the fire alarm went off so off we all trudged outside. Again it seemed quite organised however it was quite apparent some people were still in their rooms and remained there during the exercise. We were back in our rooms for 5.45am. The hotel is in a good location for Legoland and while we didn't dine in the hotel we were quite close (2 miles) to a Toby Carvery which was of good quality and great value. Parking is available in the hotel car park which is well lit, has CCTV and an attendant although trying to get a space when a function is on was difficult. We would not hesitate to return if we visited Legoland again. All the staff we encountered were very pleasant which definately made a difference to our stay.
reviews.title: Not bad but not really 4 star quality

reviews.text: The worst hotel i have ever had the misfortune of NOT sleeping in. Noisy, stunk of cigarretes and I smoke!, decor of your average caravan 40 minute check in with staff that dont know the meaning of please and thankyou. to top it off they took 3 payments of over £300 for a 1 night £85 room. Avoid at all costs, you have been warned
reviews.title: The WORST hotel in the world, probably!

reviews.text: we stayed here for one night with a package to lego land (which we found totally crap dont go there) the hotel was nice quick check in when we arrived. The only thing that really bothered us was the strange smell on our floor (4th) and in our room it was like smelly feet that had lingered to long, thank god i'd put an air freshner spray in otherwise it would of been unbearable, which is a shame because the hotel and our room was very nice. We have stayed in worse. The room was basic but clean enough for me the bathroom was ok too. Nice colour tv with loads of channels and internet acess if needed. The food is over priced but very worth it we ate in the restaurant as it was my daughters birthday and we decided to treat ourselves. London and all that way is very over priced for EVERYTHING. Being from wales all our local heritage attractions are free to get into. Wished we had booked a day out in oakwood park instead. would i go back again to this hotel, yes it wasnt too bad.
reviews.title: a very nice stay

likes.liked: — near to where we wanted to go .

reviews.text: The cost of a very ordinary cheeseburger and chips, sitting in the bar was £13.10. It was grossly overpriced. The bar menu was very limited.
reviews.title: Expensive bar meal. Hot bedrooms

likes.disliked: — expensive food, room too hot. No table cloths on tables. No twin rooms for disabled.

reviews.text: The bedroom was far too hot, even with the climate control set to minimum temperature.
reviews.title: Perfect family getaway

likes.disliked: — Would have liked biscuits in room - no one does that any more why ??!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ages to wait for the one lift , the second lift was not working.
reviews.title: Breakfast Terrible
